intro: Manettia marginata, commonly known as the marginate manettia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with a distinctive white margin. Its small, fragrant flowers are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. Manettia marginata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
